text: How does Netflix know exactly what you want to watch... before YOU do?
It starts with scale. 230 Million users. 18,000 titles. That's billions of possible combinations.
They track everything. Explicit signals like your thumbs up... and implicit ones, like what you rewound or binged.
It's a massive funnel. They take thousands of candidates, filter them down to hundreds, and rank them instantly.
Collaborative filtering finds users like you. If they watched Stranger Things, you probably will too.
Then comes Ranking. The algorithm scores every title based on the probability you'll actually hit play.
It gets crazy. Even the thumbnail is personalized! You might see an action shot, while I see a romantic close-up.
So remember: It's Data Collection, Filtering, Ranking, and Artwork Personalization. That's the secret sauce!
